config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'skipUpscaling' is a boolean option that determines whether to skip upscaling images during the image processing. When the configuration is enabled (true), the system will skip upscaling images, and when it is disabled (false), the system will perform upscaling as part of the image processing.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'skipUpscaling' configuration depends on the user's preference and the input images. If the user sets 'skipUpscaling' to true, the configuration will be triggered whenever the image processing task is executed. If the user sets 'skipUpscaling' to false, the configuration will not be triggered, and upscaling will be performed as usual.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'skipUpscaling' configuration option on the system is that it can affect the quality and size of the output images. When 'skipUpscaling' is enabled, the system will skip the upscaling process, which may result in lower quality output images but potentially smaller file sizes. On the other hand, when 'skipUpscaling' is disabled, the system will perform upscaling, leading to higher quality images but potentially larger file sizes.
